intro: Cynanchum wilfordii, commonly known as Chinese milkweed or wild ginseng, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by follicles containing seeds with silky hairs. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and stream banks. Cynanchum wilfordii is valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
